channel.description:
What do you guys think of society nowadays? Stable, unstable, broken?

Discuss.

item.title: Society
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Normal employees (Let us forget non-working people for a moment) do all the hard work, they would never get as rich as those hiring them. It doesn't matter how hard you work, you must over to the "evil side". The only way to get rich is to be lucky or make other people work for you. As an capitalist you would get the surplus value of what your employees produce. The only way to get rich is to pay your workers less than the value they create. The entitled one is the rich capitalists. So if you think the big problem with society is people demanding money from others, abolish capitalism.

Your picture looks more like feudalism than capitalism. Feudalism makes it impossible to move up in class. Capitalism is easier.

Normal employees (Let us forget non-working people for a moment) do all the hard work, they would never get as rich as those hiring them. It doesn't matter how hard you work, you must over to the "evil side".

The “evil side”? The people who make more money than their employees? I don’t understand how that is evil. Normal employees do get paid more depending on how hard they work. They won’t become a millionaire (as I have already established numerous times) but they will move up in the middle class as t4 stated: upper middle, middle, and lower middle class. They won’t be super duper insane rich as you want them to be, but they will be making good money.

The only way to get rich is to be lucky or make other people work for you. As an capitalist you would get the surplus value of what your employees produce. The only way to get rich is to pay your workers less than the value they create.

Well first I would like to say: Luck is where preparation meets opportunity. And yes, as the owner of a business you will make more than the employee because you own the business, it was your idea and you put the money into the business. An employer can choose to pay his employees more money if he likes their performance. Many employers have it written into their employee’s contracts that they will get a 5% pay raise each year. I would also like to point out that you make it seem as though employers don’t do anything. Most employers do actually work and earn their salary. Paying workers less value than they create? Is this evil? It’s called making a profit. A smart employer pays his workers enough to keep them. If the employer isn’t paying enough the employee will either leave or another competitive company will snatch him up to earn them money.

PS: Is this thread still on track?

I think so

item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

i don’t think that picture is accurate… the way i see it:

the upper class has the most wealth and it is almost impossible to transcend to this status unless luck/inheritance/evil are used.

the middle class is divided into upper/middle/lower; upper being the rich with a net worth of a few million, middle being the average white collar worker, and lower being the low-paying white collar/high-paying blue collar. going up through these classes usually entails higher education/luck.

the lower class is obviously anyone who falls below the high-paying blue collar mark.

depending on the area, the majority of the people who inhabit are most likely of the lower class or lower-middle/middle middle class.

edit: to make it clear, the upper class has pretty much all the power in a capitalist society/corrupt government. there is also a HUGE gap between upper-class and upper-middle class.

item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:52, topic:447153”][quote author=ytuio9` link=topic=550051.msg4035002#msg4035002 date=1341114399]
So by your reasoning scientists should not be paid as much as a miner because they do not physically use their bodies as much as miners do?
[/quote]
M1lkman’s reasoning. If hard work should pay off, then it should be like that.

But it doesn’t do that, you can work as much as you want, but you would never be as rich as the capitalists. Since there is a limited amount of people can be capitalists, then it would always be someone with little economic power and people with waste amount of economic power, In US this have lead to the abolishment of the democracy. (If they ever had one)

The media and those who advertise, is those who decide the elections. They decide what message your hear and what to see, and they decide how to report the news stories. Take the health care reform. 95% said it was unconstitutional in a Fox News poll, and 90% said it was constitutional in a more liberal audience. It is a bad sign when the News corporations reject the reality and substitute it with their own mindset. Because something is wrong when your interpretation of the constitution is depended of your “ideology”.
(The exact numbers isn’t as important, and might be slightly incorrect)

Your ability to lobbying in US is too small to have any effect. If you are rich you could buy some politicians if you want. It doesn’t matter who you vote for when both candidates are bought by the same people. This does not only apply to the political world. As neither the politicians nor the people is controlling the economy. Americans are letting a small non-elected elite control the most important in their country.

Or is it OK in a society that someone has more power than other, based on luck, exploiting and inheritance?[/quote]

I think you are twisting my words. You said I said

hard work should pay off
. Hard work DOES payoff in today’s capitalistic society. You make it seem as though it doesn’t.

The problem is everyone wants to be a millionaire but nobody wants to work to become a millionaire. The people in poverty EXPECT the government to come through with welfare, food stamps, etc. The government should provide the minimum to stay alive but then people think, “Oh, look at this person who has millions of dollars. Why can’t I be that rich? It isn’t fair!”. Then people think they are entitled to get a television set, cable, internet, and a cell phone. The rich are getting richer and the poor are getting richer too. The people who are homeless CHOSE to be homeless. I have asked a group of homeless people why they are homeless and most of them said they didn’t think they needed to pay taxes so the best way of avoiding taxes is to be homeless. They think the rich should pay the taxes for them. I then asked if they were happy being homeless. Most said yes, they have the money from pan handling to buy a case of beer every night, a group of people they can call a family, and no government breathing down their neck. Do you think these people deserve that kind of lifestyle? They are living like reckless teenagers. They don’t work hard but they feel they are entitled to everything everyone else is getting.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:46, topic:447153”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=550051.msg4034467#msg4034467 date=1341079436]

You’re clearly fucking retarded. People are poor because the rich people have society built where the rich people stay rich, the middle class do all the work, and the poor people stay poor. The rockerfeller family has enough money to feed, shelter, and cloth the whole world. Greedy fucking bastards.

This pisses me off. People bitch and moan because they would rather receive a handout than work hard. That is the cancer that is killing society. Not greed or wealth but the idea of entitlements.
[/quote]
Good that we agree, we should abolish inheritance and gifts above a certain value. Lets us give higher wages to people who work hard, like miners. And give lower wages to those who only tell other people what to do. I think your idea works perfectly to a certain degree.

Wage = Hours * Hard Work Index * CONSTANT.
Hard Work index for average job is at 100, and then modify it by how much harder your job (By a percentage) is compared to the average.
The constant is the same for everyone, and is modified when you want to modify the wage level. And yes, abolish all gambling, as that has nothing to do with hard work. (Gabling like in betting on the Stock Exchange)

I’m not sure how smart this is, but this is how it should be according to your hard work mindset.[/quote]

No. The money is in managing. The way I view it: Everyone can be a miner; not everyone can manage a group of people. Hence the manager earns more money. The manager (normally) has more experience mining and was indeed a miner. Managers normally have gone to school or have shown exceptional work ethic - hence why they have been promoted among the other miners. I say normally so often because there are some who shouldn’t be in management and are only there because of nepotism, racism, or sexism. <— Those should be abolished first.

There is money in hard labor jobs. Plumbers, one who goes to houses and fixes peoples’ plumbing, make more money than a help desk assistant, one who answers questions and fixes peoples computer from the office.

I’m not sure I agree with the abolishment of inheritance (Parent to child). I could be persuaded :P.
